melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: God is perfect - He is the Inner-knower, the Searcher of hearts.

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. The feelings instilled by this Raag can be compared to those of a bride on the day of her wedding; she is happy and sad. Although she is going to her groom, who fills her with hope and joy, she is also sad to be leaving her family.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

translation.text: He blesses us with the gift of the dust of the feet of the Saints. ||1||

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. Although she is going to her groom, who fills her with hope and joy, she is also sad to be leaving her family.

translation.text: Bless me with Your Grace, God, O Merciful to the meek.

translation.text: I seek Your Protection, O Perfect Lord, Sustainer of the World. ||1||Pause||

translation.text: He is totally pervading and permeating the water, the land and the sky.

text: ਜਿਸ ਨੋ ਨਦਰਿ ਕਰੇ ਸੋ ਧਿਆਏ ॥

translation.text: One whom He blesses with His Grace, meditates on Him.

transliteration.text: jis nō nadar karē sō dhiāē .

melody.description: Vadhans is based on Punjabi Folk music and is set in the traditions of ‘Ghoreea’, ‘Suhag’ and ‘Alohnian’. text: ਆਠ ਪਹਰ ਹਰਿ ਕੇ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਏ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Twenty-four hours a day, he sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord. ||3||

transliteration.text: āth pahar har kē gun gāē .3.
